definition: to change over to/to switch to/to use (sth different)
to change/to alter/to transform/to correct
to use/to employ/to have to/to eat or drink/expense or outlay/usefulness/hence/therefore

sentences.english: If Satan can't defeat us by a frontal attack, he will do it in a more subtle way.
sentences.chinese: 撒但若不能正面攻擊我們，就會改用更巧妙的詭計。

sentences.english: Shall we use the present tense or the past tense?
sentences.chinese: 我應改用現在時還是過去時？

sentences.english: In addition, Chen et al gun advocates say that the press should be simple to use.
sentences.chinese: 另外，還有陳榮袞等人提倡報章宜改用淺說。

sentences.english: Britain converted to decimal currency on February 15th, 1971.
sentences.chinese: 英國於1971年2月15日改用十進位幣制。

sentences.english: Yo momma's so ugly, the government moved Halloween to her birthday.
sentences.chinese: 你媽是個醜八怪，政府改用她的生日做萬聖節。

sentences.english: From now on we'll shift to the third drop.
sentences.chinese: 從現在起，我們改用第三密藏點。

sentences.english: It was recommended that the annual maximum value method is worth to accept by the design code.
sentences.chinese: 建議《室外排水設計規範》儘早改用年最大值法選樣。

sentences.english: Originally, flute is belong to woodwind, later made by metal.
sentences.chinese: 長笛原來屬於木管樂器，後來改用金屬製造。

sentences.english: For this reason, I would be very reluctant to switch these patients to entecavir.
sentences.chinese: 正因爲如此，我們不願意讓這些患者改用恩替卡韋。

sentences.english: Another reason, then, to switch to low-energy light bulbs.
sentences.chinese: 氣候變化也是改用低能耗燈泡的原因之一。

sentences.english: Although Assyrians switched to Aramaic , it was not wholesale transplantation.
sentences.chinese: 儘管亞述人改用亞拉姆語，可它還沒有被大規模翻譯。

sentences.english: When I pick it up to race pace, the balance is still there.
sentences.chinese: 當我改用比賽速度遊時，依然保持平衡。

sentences.english: Try switching to soy milk or almond milk.
sentences.chinese: 嘗試改用豆奶或杏仁乳。

sentences.english: And while you’re de-salting your diet, don’t forget the salt in processed foods.
sentences.chinese: 在改用低鹽飲食的同時，不要忘了加工食品中的鹽分。

sentences.english: Use the background color, not background image.
sentences.chinese: 去除背景圖片，改用背景顏色。

sentences.english: Let's chat in English, what do you two think of the idea?
sentences.chinese: 這樣吧，我們以後改用英語聊天，二位意下如何？

definition: to adapt for use for another purpose
to change into
to use/to employ/to apply/to make use of
to convert/to turn into (sth else)/to adapt (a story to another medium)
to replace/to take the place of
to use/to employ/to have to/to eat or drink/expense or outlay/usefulness/hence/therefore
multipurpose/having several uses
to substitute for/to replace/to supersede
to adopt/to employ/to use
to continue to use (old methods)/to apply as before/according to usage
to replace/to supersede/to supplant/(chemistry) substitution
to stop using/to suspend/to discontinue/to disable
to choose for some purpose/to select and use
to exchange/to replace/to substitute for/to switch
to provide/installed
abbr. for Canada 加拿大[Jia1 na2 da4]/surname Jia

to add/plus/(used after an adverb such as 不, 大, 稍 etc, and before a disyllabic verb, to indicate that the action of the verb is applied to sth or sb previously mentioned)/to apply (restrictions etc) to (sb)/to give (support, consideration etc) to (sth)
